awd_abstract_narration: 9520109  Georgakakos  The California flash floods of winter 1995 will be studied  by surveying the affected areas, collecting flood data from  Federal and State agencies and by using historical,  topographical, hydrometeorological and other database  information to develop flash flood potential maps for  critical areas in the state of California.  Data of this  event will be used to validate the estimates and, if  necessary, to modify the design of the flash flood potential  algorithm.  Once validated, the mathematical model will be  used in a series of sensitivity experiments to provide,  quantitative answers to questions such as the effect of land  use changes on the magnitude and recurrence interval of the  flash flood potential index and the role of antecedent soil  moisture of mountainou terrain.  The resultant prototype  flash flood potential maps will be of value in activities  such as in the design of the safety criteria of small dams,  in the assessment of the flash flood risk, and in early  warning when combined with radar rainfall data.  ***
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation
